title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.49 - Exclusion from hearing; striking testimony
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.49 - Exclusion from hearing; striking testimony

State Regulations
(a) Disobedient or contemptuous conduct
before the Board or hearing officer is grounds for exclusion from a
hearing. (b) The refusal of a
witness at any hearing to answer a question which has been found by the Board
to be proper may, at the discretion of the Board, be grounds for striking all
or any part of the testimony previously given by the witness on related matters
and drawing inferences from such refusal. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
65.49

Adopted

New

York State Register March 30, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 13, eff. 3/30/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
